perturbation.original_text: Within ten (10) days following the earlier to occur of (i) a ratings downgrade by each of the Rating Agencies of Verizon to below investment grade, or (ii) a Servicer Termination Event, the Servicer will send a notice to all Obligors indicating (a) that their Receivables have been assigned to the Issuer, and (b)(x) if Cellco has not been removed as Servicer, that the Obligors shall continue to make their payments as they had previously, or (y) if Cellco has been removed as Servicer, the name of the Successor Servicer and any new instructions with respect to their payments.
perturbation.changed_text: Within forty-five (45) days following the earlier to occur of (i) a ratings downgrade by each of the Rating Agencies of Verizon to below investment grade, or (ii) a Servicer Termination Event, the Servicer will send a notice to all Obligors indicating (a) that their Receivables have been assigned to the Issuer, and (b)(x) if Cellco has not been removed as Servicer, that the Obligors shall continue to make their payments as they had previously, or (y) if Cellco has been removed as Servicer, the name of the Successor Servicer and any new instructions with respect to their payments.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the notification period to 45 days, potentially conflicting with consumer protection laws that require prompt notification of assignment of debt or changes in servicing, affecting Obligors rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Financial Protection Act, Fair Debt Collection Practices Act

perturbation.original_text: If a Servicer Termination Event occurs and is continuing, the Indenture Trustee may and, if directed by the Noteholders of a majority of the Note Balance of the Controlling Class, must remove the Servicer and terminate its rights and obligations under this Agreement by notifying the Servicer, the Issuer, the Parent Support Provider, the Owner Trustee, and the Secured Parties. The notice of termination will state the date the termination will be effective. On receipt of the notice, the Issuer will promptly notify the Rating Agencies, and the Owner Trustee will promptly notify the Certificateholders.
perturbation.changed_text: If a Servicer Termination Event occurs and is continuing, the Indenture Trustee may remove the Servicer and terminate its rights and obligations under this Agreement by notifying the Servicer, the Issuer, the Parent Support Provider, the Owner Trustee, and the Secured Parties within 180 days. The notice of termination will state the date the termination will be effective. On receipt of the notice, the Issuer will notify the Rating Agencies and the Owner Trustee will notify the Certificateholders within the time deemed reasonable.
perturbation.explanation: By extending the period of Indenture Trustee action (termination) to 180 days may conflict with regulations necessitating prompt action after discovering severe non-compliance. Also, the time frame to notify Rating Agencies is open-ended.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Dodd-Frank Act, specifically regulations related to servicer responsibilities in asset-backed securities.

perturbation.original_text: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each fiscal year for which a report on Form 10-K is required to be filed with the Commission by or on behalf of the Issuer (commencing with the fiscal year ended December 31, 2020), the Servicer will deliver an Officer's Certificate to the Administrator, the Depositor, the Owner Trustee and the Indenture Trustee to the effect that (A) a review of the Servicer's activities during the prior fiscal year (or since the Closing Date in the case of the first such Officer's Certificate) and of its performance under this Agreement has been made under the supervision of the officer executing such Officer's Certificate and (B) to the best of his or her knowledge, based on the review, the Servicer has fulfilled in all material respects its obligations under this Agreement, or, if there has been a failure to fulfill any such obligation in any material respect, specifying each such failure known to such officer and the nature and status of the failure.
perturbation.changed_text: Within one hundred and fifty (150) days after the end of each fiscal year for which a report on Form 10-K is required to be filed with the Commission by or on behalf of the Issuer (commencing with the fiscal year ended December 31, 2020), the Servicer will deliver an Officer's Certificate to the Administrator, the Depositor, the Owner Trustee and the Indenture Trustee to the effect that (A) a review of the Servicer's activities during the prior fiscal year (or since the Closing Date in the case of the first such Officer's Certificate) and of its performance under this Agreement has been made under the supervision of the officer executing such Officer's Certificate and (B) to the best of his or her knowledge, based on the review, the Servicer has fulfilled in all material respects its obligations under this Agreement, or, if there has been a failure to fulfill any such obligation in any material respect, specifying each such failure known to such officer and the nature and status of the failure.
perturbation.explanation: The modification increases the deadline for delivering the Officer's Certificate, potentially conflicting with SEC regulations (Regulation AB) that require timely reporting and assessment of compliance with servicing criteria, thereby weakening investor protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Regulation AB of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
